data.text: I received this message from Yahweh about Tyre city:
You people who live along the coast near Tyre, and merchants of Sidon city, mourn silently.
But now you people in Sidon should be ashamed,
When the people of Egypt hear what has happened to Tyre,
Sail to Tarshish and tell them what happened;
The people in the very old city of Tyre were [RHQ] previously joyful.
People from Tyre appointed kings over other places;
It was the Commander of the armies of angels who did it;
You people of Tarshish, you must grow crops in your land instead of trading;
It is as though Yahweh stretched out his hand over the sea
He said to the people of Sidon,
Think about what happened in Babylonia:
So wail, you sailors on the ships of Tarshish,
For seventy years, which is as long as kings usually live, people will forget about Tyre. But then it will be rebuilt. What will happen there will be like what happened to a prostitute in this song:
â€œYou harlot, whom people had forgotten,
It is true that after seventy years Yahweh will restore Tyre. Their merchants will again earn a lot of money by buying things from and selling things to many other nations [HYP].
But their profits will be given to Yahweh.
